alert.note: Alert for Edwards (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 25 at 12:52PM CDT until October 27 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Edwards. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM CDT, Doppler radar continue to show moderate to heavy rain across some areas of the advisory. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the eastern part of the advisory. This additional rain will result in minor flooding over some spots. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Edwards County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
